title: 115_hr1972
content: The "VA Billing Accountability Act" allows the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to waive copayments for certain veterans in cases of department errors. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs can waive veteran copayments if a Department error caused a delay in notification, as per the VA Billing Accountability Act. The Secretary may waive veteran copayments if a Department error caused a delay in notification, as per the VA Billing Accountability Act. New billing procedures are outlined in the amendment. The Secretary must notify veterans of required payments within 180 days of receiving care. If notification is delayed, the Secretary cannot collect payment without offering options for a waiver or payment plan. The Secretary must notify veterans of required payments within 18 months of receiving care at a non-Department facility. If notification is delayed, the Secretary cannot collect payment without offering options for a waiver or payment plan. The Secretary may waive payment requirements for care at non-Department facilities if notification delay was due to Department error. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must review and improve copayment billing controls and procedures within 180 days of the enactment of the Act. Passed by the House of Representatives on May 21, 2018.
